projects.title: Looper Inc.
projects.description:
\{Looper Inc.\} is a bit of a passion project that started in 2022, when I made a game for school. Sadly, shortly after finishing the game, my computer's SSD drive broke, and the game was lost. The game was not very impressive in any kind of way, as it was made in only 4 months, and it was my first time ever designing and making an actual game. \{Looper Inc.\} aims to be a remake and, if possible, a finalisation of the game.

But now about the gameplay:
\{Looper Inc.\} is a movement based game inspired by games such as \{Karlson\} and \{Titanfall 2\}, featuring high-speed movement and parkour. However, it also features a unique mechanic: \{Time Travel\}

More specifically, \{Time Reversal\}, mostly inspired but the movie \{Tenet\} or the game \{The Entropy Centre\}

Development is still in its earliest stages and scince I do not have much free time to spend on this project, this project is not ready to be finished anytime soon.

projects.title: MAZESWAP
projects.description: For the \{GMTK Game Jam\} of \{2023\}, which had the theme \{Roles Reversed\}, me and a friend worked together on making a game in \{p5.js\}. The end result was a fun little two-player game in where you hunt each other down in a maze while trying to find the exit.

projects.title: Superhot Chess
projects.description: A while ago, I wanted to try to create a version of chess where both players submit and make their move at the same time. The game would end when the king piece was slain, not checkmated, and if two pieces walked to the same place, the higher ranking one would win or they would annihilate each other. Sadly, I stopped working on the project before I had a complete chess game. I am unsure whether I want to return to this project.

projects.title: Traffic Lights AI
projects.description:
Together with a friend, attempted to create a \{traffic simulation\} that uses \{AI\} to control \{traffic lights\}. The idea was to find out wether AI is able to manage traffic lights more efficiently than the \{Dutch Traffic System\}, which is quite hard to do, scince the Dutch system is one of the most elaborate systems in the world.

We ended up concluding that at least in our case, AI is unable to solve our problem. You can download the source code by using the button down below.

projects.title: VR Game Project
projects.description: Lately, I've been trying to learn \{VR developement\} in Unity. However I am unsure wether I want to make a project with it later. I do have some \{ideas\} for what I want to make with it, but these are still deep in the ideas drawer.

projects.title: Portfolio Website
projects.description:
I've had a lot of fun making this \{portfolio\} website and the parts it's made up of, like the \{Bowyer-Watson\} algorithm used in the background, the automatic project and art loaders. I know it could be done better, and might remake it in the future.

There are also easter eggs around, and I suggest looking at the \{version number\}

projects.title: Marching Cubes
projects.description: Implementing interesting \{algorithms\} into Unity is quite fun. This one however is quite a challenge, especially on a greater scale, when performance is very important. I am currently working on this to possibly use it together with my \{VR Project\}, however, I still have a long ways to go.

projects.title: Launchpad Soundboard Application
projects.description: This is a program I've made for my father, who wanted a simple way to play sounds and music when playing \{role playing games\}. I decided to use a \{launchpad\}, which is a midi controller with a bunch of buttons. I also decided to make it all in \{C++\} without any other applications. It didn't end up being the most beautiful code, and it only has support for windows, but I am quite happy with this little application that I made. I might however some day come back to it and make it again.
